space.arim.nameless.api

Interface LiteNameless

  • All Superinterfaces:
    space.arim.universal.util.AutoClosable, AutoCloseable, space.arim.universal.registry.Registrable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LiteNamelessCore

    public interface LiteNameless
extends space.arim.universal.registry.Registrable, space.arim.universal.util.AutoClosable
    General LiteNameless API

    Detached from BungeeCord, Spigot, or Sponge.
    SenderWrapper and PlayerWrapper are used for command senders and players.
    Author:
    A248

    • Method Detail

      • reload

        void reload()
        Reloads the plugin

      • enabled

        boolean enabled()
        Checks whether the plugin is enabled.

        The plugin is considered enabled if and only if:
        * enable-plugin is true in the config.yml * The host and api key specified in config.yml are valid
        Returns:
        true if enabled, false otherwise

      • getRegistry

        space.arim.universal.registry.Registry getRegistry()
        Gets the Registry associated with LiteNameless
        Returns:
        the registry

      • executeCommand

        boolean executeCommand(SenderWrapper player,
                       String[] args)
        Executes a command for a player with given arguments.
        May be used to simulate command execution.
        Parameters:
        player - a wrapped player
        args - array of command arguments
        Returns:
        true to indicate elementary command success, rarely false

      • updateGroupSynchronous

        void updateGroupSynchronous(PlayerWrapper player)
        Same as updateGroup(PlayerWrapper) but conducts the operation synchronously.

        Most programmers will not need this method, unless calling code is already asynchronous.
        Care should always be taken to ensure IO operations do not run on the main thread
        Parameters:
        player - the wrapped player whose group will be updated

      • updateGroup

        void updateGroup(PlayerWrapper player)
        Detects a player's group and updates it on the Nameless website.

        The plugin automatically updates a player's group on login; however, programmers may require this method if a player's group changes while they are online. For example, a shop plugin, which updates a player's rank ingame, would also want to reload the user's group on the website.

        Process:
        1. The plugin scans the group IDs specified in config.yml.
        2. If the player has the permission corresponding to the group ID, the plugin will use that ID. If the player has multiple permissions corresponding to different group IDs, the plugin will use the last group ID in the configuration list.
        3. The plugin will update the user's group on the Nameless website.

        The procedure is done asynchronously blocking the main thread.
        In rare cases, (for example, if calling code is already asynchronous), updateGroupSynchronous(PlayerWrapper) may be used.
        Parameters:
        player - the wrapped player whose group will be updated
